lines.text:
[reading the novel that she's just finished]
"For long as I could remember, the house on the Larkin Street Hill had been home. Papa and Mama had both born in Norway but they came to San Francisco because Mama's sisters were here, all of us were born here. Nels, the oldest and the only boy, my sister Christine and the littlest sister Dagmar but first and foremost I remember Mama".
Being rich is like being ten feet tall. Good for some things, bad for others.
I'm a better physician than most doctors!

[heaving a sigh of relief after doing the weekly household account]
It's good - we do not have to go to the bank.

[exasperated]
You will do no such thing, sir!
Always I watch operation. I'm the head of the family.
I allow no-one to attend my operations!
All this expense to watch a miserable old man die of the d.t.'s!
